bitfields.name: BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Primary boot source

values.name: SECONDARY_BOOTLOADER
values.description: Secondary Boot loader in Bank1 IFR0 (32KB)

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Recovery boot source

values.name: SB3 img
values.description: SB3 image in 1-bit SPI flash connected to default FlexComm. FC7

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Boot speed. Selects the core frequency and voltage to use during ROM execution

values.name: DEFAULT
values.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x9635

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description: Flash remap size. FLASH_REMAP_SIZE defines the size of the secondary boot image (the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SIZE + 1)

bitfields.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT
bitfields.description: Defines flash protection of Bank1_IFR0 area based on usage. The MBC module is used to configure the access protections as readable (R), writeable (W), and/or executable (X). The access protections can also be configured as locked (L) which prevents later application code from changing the access protection configuration. The final MBC protection bits used for Bank1_IFR0 depend on the boot mode configuration, the boot path that is selected and the device life cycle state. The access This field will only modify the MBC protection bits for the Bank1_IFR0 area after the life cycle is advanced out of Develop. In the Develop life cycle state this field has no effect. For example, if using the In-Field life cycle and Bank1_IFR0 is being used as a recovery boot image (REC_BOOT_SRC = 1) and OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT value = 5 is selected), then for a regular boot using the primary image Bank1_IFR0 is mapped to GLBAC2. If the primary boot fails, and the recovery path is taken, then Bank1_IFR0 is mapped to GLBAC4 instead. Note: Settings 5-7 should not be used if Bank1_IFR0 is used as OEM_SBL (BOOT_SRC = 2). In Develop life cycle - All settings: MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1110 (GLBAC0) In other life cycles â€“

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command

bitfields.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bitfields.name: ISP_FT_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry on image authentication failure

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on recovery boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high, identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and fall through to recovery boot source. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on ISP fall through. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode. [[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bitfields.description: Assert on fatal errors during boot. ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. [4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. [7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4 ports are allowed. If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description: Powerdown timeout: ISP mode peripheral detection timeout value in seconds. If a non-zero value is program and peripheral activity is not detected within the number of seconds specified here, then the device will go to power down mode to conserve power

bitfields.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_COUNT
bitfields.description: WDOG timeout: Upper 16 bits of 24-bit count value in WWDT0_TC register Timeout value in seconds. The lower 8 bits of WWDT0_TC are set to 0. When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code

registers.name: FLEXSPI_CFG0
registers.description: ROM code will not manage these fields, but SDK driver can manage these.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description: Define typical Serial NOR Flash types

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command. If a non-zero value is programmed in this field, then the value is used to override the default number of dummy cycles for a fast read command read from the serial flashâ€™s SFDP information. Note: this field is only used if FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description: Q/O-SPI flash interface frequency

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use O/QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PORT
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO port number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PIN
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after reset before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices. Note, for POR in addition to this wait time FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME is added

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by FLEXSPI_HOLD TIME field

bitfields.name: PORT_SEL
bitfields.description: Defines which FlexSPI portA/B is used for boot

registers.name: FLEXSPI_CFG1
registers.description: ROM code will not manage these fields, but SDK driver can manage these.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description: Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS). The value provided here is loaded into the FLEXSPIn_DLLnCR

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FlLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of the second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. If this field is left blank boot ROM will not enable FlexSPI remap feature. The physical flash offset is computed as below: physical offset = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description: Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. b'0000 Remap size = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SCK_PIN

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_MOSI ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_MOSI_PIN

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_MISO_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default SPI_MISO ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.description: SPI chip select number. FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects

bitfields.description: Use customer defined pins for 1-bit SPI recovery boot pins

registers.name: Reserved 0x00028
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

bitfields.description: Customer defined USB vendor ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration

bitfields.name: USB_PRODUCT_ID
bitfields.description: Customer defined USB product ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration

bitfields.name: USBX_VBUS_PIN
bitfields.description: Override default USBx_VBUS_DETECT ISP pin. Identifies the pin to be used as USBx_VBUS detect pin. [4:0] GPIO Pin number [7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by USBx_VBUS_PIN

bitfields.name: EXT_XTAL_CLK
bitfields.description: USB PHY input clock frequency. For USB high speed PHY external XTAL input is needed. This field specifies the frequency of XTAL used on board. â€¢ 000 - 24MHz input clock (Divide by 20) - Default option when CMPA is blank. â€¢ 001 - 30MHz input clock (Divide by 16) â€¢ 010 - 32MHz input clock (Divide by 15) â€¢ 011 - Reserved â€¢ 100 - 20MHz input clock (Divide by 24) â€¢ 101 - 19.2MHz input clock (Divide by 25) â€¢ 110 - 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) â€¢ 111 - 12MHz input clock (Divide by 40)

bitfields.name: PRE_DIV
bitfields.description: Enable Pre-divider. Needed to support 48MHz and other high speed crystals

bitfields.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDR
bitfields.description: I2C slave address A 7-bit Address used for selecting our device on shared I2C bus system. By default ROM uses 0x10 as slave address. If this address conflicts with another slave on board customer could use this field to override the address

bitfields.name: ISP_USB_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined GPIO for USB VBUS detect function during ISP mode

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: inverse value of [15:0]

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_EN

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Set FA mode command Fixed state

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Mass erase flash command fixed state

bitfields.name: CPU1_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: CPU1_DBGEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 debug Fixed state

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: inverse value of [15:0]

bitfields.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bitfields.description: Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area (CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU)

registers.name: Reserved 0x0004C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description: Secure boot enforcement. This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign). The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it

values.name: CRC32 or signed
values.description: Only CRC32 or cryptographically signed (CMAC or ECDSA or MLDSA) images are allowed

values.name: Signed only
values.description: Only cryptographically Signed (CMAC or ECDSA or MLDSA) images are allowed

values.name: PKI signed only
values.description: Only PKI signed (ECDSA or MLDSA) images are allowed

bitfields.name: LP_SEC_BOOT
bitfields.description: LP_SEC_BOOT: Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down & deep-power down. For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always

values.name: CFPA/CMPA & CRC32
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CRC32 check of active image. Uses AHB_CRC image type to check image CRC and loads TZ-M preset data if present before jumping to the image

values.name: CFPA/CMPA & vector addr
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & jump to vector address specified in CFPA

values.name: CFPA/CMPA & CMAC
values.description: CRC check for CFPA/CMPA & CMAC check of active image. Uses AHB_CRC image type to check image CRC and loads TZ-M preset data if present before jumping to the image

bitfields.name: DICE_CSR_KEY_TYPE
bitfields.description: Define the DICE csr and key generation type

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA
bitfields.description: Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication

values.name: AT_LEAST_CNSA10_0
values.description: At least CNSA 1.0 algorithms are used. (ECC P-384, SHA384 & AES256)

values.name: AT_LEAST_CNSA10_1
values.description: At least CNSA 1.0 algorithms are used. (ECC P-384, SHA384 & AES256)

values.name: ONLY_CNSA20_2
values.description: Only CNSA 2.0 algorithms are used.(ECDSA P-384 + MLDSA-87, ML-KEM, SHA384 & AES256)

values.name: ONLY_CNSA20_3
values.description: Only CNSA 2.0 algorithms are used.(ECDSA P-384 + MLDSA-87, ML-KEM, SHA384 & AES256)

bitfields.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET
bitfields.description: TrustZone-M mode

values.name: ENFORCED_1
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

values.name: ENFORCED_2
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

values.name: ENFORCED_3
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest

bitfields.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE
bitfields.description: RAM zeroize on ITRC event. Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion & Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3)

values.name: Always on ITRC
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC RAM on ITRC event only

values.name: On ITRC
values.description: Zeroize PKC & RAMA on ITRC event only

values.name: Always on all reset boot
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC & RAMA on all reset boot

bitfields.name: ACTIVE_IMG_PROT
bitfields.description: Protection of active image. This field defines protection of flash area occupied by the active image. Only applicable to internal flash

values.name: CFPA Flash
values.description: Protection is defined using the CFPA FLASH_ACL settings

values.name: Write with sticky lock
values.description: Write protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC2 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

values.name: Write without sticky lock
values.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

values.name: XOM with sticky lock
values.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored

bitfields.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS]

values.name: ISP on failure
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery

values.name: Lock on failure
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle

values.name: ISP on failure

values.name: Lock on failure

bitfields.name: SKIP_DICE
bitfields.description: Skip DICE computation

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area (IFR1) containing specific part configuration data defined during chip manufacturing process in DICE computation

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include data from CMPA page (512 bytes) in DICE computation

bitfields.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 0. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 2. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 2. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description: Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 3. When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 1x - ROM API will perform erase check

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX3
bitfields.description: Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 3 settings

bitfields.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
bitfields.description: Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image. Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image. ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature

bitfields.name: REC_IMG_EXT1
bitfields.description: rec img ext1 (bitmap mask for recovery image extended sectors 40 -63)
